definition: T-junction
fourth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/fourth in order/letter "D" or Roman "IV" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/ancient Chinese compass point: 195°/butyl/cubes (of food)
surname Ding
letter/symbol/character/word/CL:個|个[ge4]/courtesy or style name traditionally given to males aged 20 in dynastic China
street/CL:條|条[tiao2]

sentences.english: Clearly he saw a T-crossing, lying in front of him.
sentences.chinese: 他清清楚楚地看见一条丁字街，横在他眼前。

sentences.english: He saw clearly a T-street to across before him.
sentences.chinese: 他清清楚楚地看见一条丁字街，横在他眼前。

sentences.english: But when they were approaching the cross in the street, they stopped suddenly and gathered into a semi-circle.
sentences.chinese: 将到丁字街口，便突然立住，簇成一个半圆。
